name: Ibis Malaga Centro Ciudad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the heart of the city only 2 minutes away from the shops, restaurants and the main sights.
reviews.title: Super!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful and comfortable with a lovely view to the city.
reviews.title: central,very good price/performance ratio,clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious.
reviews.title: Great Location - Across from the Historic Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommanded!
reviews.title: Good deal for the price!
Nice deal
reviews.text: very central located clean city hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel on a number occasions, good location for old part of city and transport links.
reviews.title: Good location consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms good size as are shower rooms, noise minimal as corridors are carpeted.
reviews.title: Very simple but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast if included is standard continental only criticism is the coffee tastes awful which considering Malaga has some great cafes.
reviews.title: good price - convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Ibis is part of the Accor chain. They offer a standardised quality controlled set of hotels.
reviews.title: Good value, great location to explore the city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But you know what you are getting for a reasonable price. 63 euro in my case for a very clean and spacious room. Loved the shower unit. Great firm bed. It is right by the old river bed and only 10 minutes easy walk to the main tourist sites.
reviews.title: Great location and standard services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much to add to previous reviews. Location of hotel is excellent - only a 10 min stroll from the very centre of town. Unlike some other reviewers, we didn't notice any youngsters hanging around the riverbed. Plenty of restaurants etc on the way too. Staff are friendly and food in the on-site restaurant is adequate, but fairly priced. Breakfast is excellent. We got a great rate on Yeego - €38 per night including breakfast. Excellent value for money! The only negative about the hotel is the fact that the rooms were VERY warm - uncomfortably so. Getting any sort of sleep at night required the window to be left open, with consequent noise. As we visited in March, it seems the hotel had not switched on the air con yet (which they seemed to have several complaints about).
reviews.title: Great location. Great price. Very hot though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here early June, arriving with a car we were able to park under the hotel. The staff were very friendly with good english. The room was clean, with just a shower cubicle in the bathroom. The location was ideal for walking into the centre of Malaga which was great for a day's visit. The area around the hotel seems not so nice when you arrive but if you walk over the bridge you are soon in the attractive centre. The only thing was that the beds were very firm, although not a problem for us. Outside the hotel you have the empty river where in the evenings sports are played by local kids which you could hear a bit from your room. Otherwise would certainly recommened this hotel, due to it's value for money, friendly staff and location.
reviews.title: Good value near the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: About a brisk 15 minute walk from the main train station. Crossing the bridge outside the hotel takes you straight into the old city which has all the attractions.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Very helpful and friendly staff. Speak many languages.
reviews.title: pillows like blocks of cement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Clean and neat, no frills.
reviews.title: Great value and can't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Definitely the best Ibis Hotel we have stayed in to date.
reviews.title: Deserves A Higher Rating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: General:
reviews.title: Amazing value, clean, breakfast included, a slight let down at the end though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - 10 to 15 minutes walk from rail station. Five minutes from old town centre. Safe, quiet area. Efficient check-in and bar service by friendly attentive staff. Spacious, relaxing lobby. Safe luggage storage. Newspapers. Internet access. Very good cold buffet breakfast until noon. Spotless throughout.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, horrible bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Great low cost Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious. Good shower. Basic toiletries. Hair dryer. Quiet. Big comfortable beds. Flat-screen T.V.s. Spanish channels, CNN and Sky News. Adequate storage. No tea/coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Faultless
a goot hotel with nice rooms
reviews.text: ask for more towels and you will get it. They cleaned the room every day but the ground not one time in 8 days. The Service was very good, and the people who work there are very kindly. The breakfirst was good.

reviews.title: New and clean but smoky
reviews.text: the room was small but had everything you would need for a short stay bar any type of place to hang many clothes. It seemed fairly new so all the facilites, shower and sink were perfectly fine. Not alot of seperation from the toilet to the room but bar all this my worst grip was the smell of cigarettes. The smell was all over the bed and pillow and the window did not open enough for it to go away. If you can choose a non smoking room its worth staying in, if you cant i wouldnt recomend it to a non smoker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good value hotel just a couple of minutes walk from Malaga town centre. Car park costs €11 per day but plan your route in advance as the one way system is a bit confusing. Third time we have used this hotel.
reviews.title: Central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We saw the reviews on T/A and wanted something cheap.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were quite surprised at the service and the hotel. It was graded as a 2-star but the service and rooms were more like 4-star. Upon our arrival (we were early)we were given a room immediately by a very friendly staff at reception who spoke very good english even though he claimed to know only a little.He then assisted us with various queries regarding parking, tourist attractions and how to get to places.
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011.
reviews.title: Great value for price - definitely recommend!
Malaga in august
reviews.text: Location: Fantastic. 5-10 minute walk to plaza/shopping/restaurants. Malagueta beach was about a 30-40 minute walk but we were not in Malaga to go to the beach every day. We found the surrounding area to be totally safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Room: Comfortable bed and pillows, closet to hang clothes, flat screen TV, bench to store luggage, bathroom was nice except a bit of mold was forming in the shower since there was no fan. No safe in the room but you can use the safe service (free) through the front desk. WIFI was 5 euros for 24 hours
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Service: Excellent, front desk speaks English, very welcoming/helpful
reviews.title: Best value in central Malaga - but not for revellers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this wonderful hotel. The hotel concept is minimalist, but the rooms and bathrooms are so well designed that you have everything you need, where you need it. The breakfast buffet was a good value and the hotel staff were very helpful. Our only complaint was that we had to pay for the internet in our room, but it was high speed and connected easily with their password. I'd look for other hotels in this chain. We even had a king-size bed, which is unheard of in most hotels in Europe. Excellent value and comfort for the money
reviews.title: Best value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is just what you'd expect from an Ibis. Basic but clean. Its location is great and easy to drive to and well-signposted from the main road. We were given helpful information by the staff on reception. However, reception seemed understaffed and we had to wait some time for check in, check out, etc. We stayed here during Semana Santa and the church behind the hotel had its parade which returned 2am-3am and was very loud. Otherwise, it would seem to be a pretty quiet place.
reviews.title: Good value, central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent, 5 mins walk to the centre of town. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Did not eat or drink in the hotel, there's lot of bars and restaurants closeby where you can get breakfast, dinner, drinks, etc. Great value at 44/eur a night.
reviews.title: Great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Expected so little... Got so much! Brilliant value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: As a seasoned Accor traveller, staying at their various chains including Novotel, Mercure and Ibis, i am generally impression with the service, accommodation and extras. However this hotel does not get included in my praise. Having driven here (with the assistance of a Tom Tom GPS) the hotel's formal address is the pedestrian access, meaning that there is an estuary in front and no car access. This meant i spent the next 90mins attempting to navigate around the hotel and city trying to access their carpark. Blink and you will miss it on a one way street, and coming around for a second go is easier said than done.
reviews.title: Not the best impression for an Accor hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Apart from access, the hotel is generally clean, neat and tidy. The bed comfortable and the AC good. However, there is a wonderful catch with the wifi access... as an Accor member the wifi generally comes free, and there are numerous posters throughout the hotel advertising free wifi! This is however, not for Accor members, but for Ibis members, another offset of club membership. The hotel justifies charging 5euros a day for wifi as the rate for the room is cheap, however if like me, the need to mix in business with pleasure is frequent, you end up paying as much for a room at the 3/4 star accor hotels - which is included free there. The wifi will also kick you off frequently during the 24 hour period and reception are not in the least interested in this issue.
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Would i stay here again? Not a chance, spend another ten euro and stay at the better hotel with less hassles... and cheaper car parking. 12 euros a night - poor.
reviews.title: If you don't speak spanish, don't go here, the staff hates non-spanish speakers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big room, great shower, free wifi, great location ..... it might not have a lot of character but it has everything else! I found the staff very helpful and my Spanish is dismal.
reviews.title: Good spot - Good price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually visit Ibis/Etap-hotels in Benelux and France. Staff is very friendly and is very helpfull. They understand normally that if you don't speak the language they will try to help you in English.
reviews.title: Excellent!

description: In the centre of Malaga, easily accessible from the airport, the Ibis Ciudad de Malaga hotel is close to the principal tourist sites of southern Spain. The city centre and its numerous museums are nearby via the pedestrian streets of the capital of the Costa Del Sol. 189 airconditioned smoking or non smoking rooms are available for booking, with WiFi Internet access. The hotel features a bar and undercover parking. Pets accepted.
